Description.val:
The Common Defensive Weapon System (CDWS) consists of a GAU-21 .50 caliber Machine Gun, cradle, ammo box, feed/link chutes and a platform specific mount system. For the MV-22 CDWS, which is in production, Ramp Mount Weapon Systems (RMWS) will be procured.  CDWS was procured to replace obsolete GAU-16 and XM-218 .50 caliber Machine Guns. CDWS enhances the warfighters overall capability by providing a safer, more reliable and accurate weapon system with a higher rate of fire.

Funding also supports the modification of medium caliber gun systems used on Navy/Marine Aircraft as well as modifications to crew served weapons including the 7.62mm and .50 cal machine guns currently used on Navy/Marine Helicopters. The modifications to Crew Serve Weapon Systems will increase safety and reliability.

Justification.val:
FY 2019 funding will procure 22 modified RMWS for the MV-22 aircraft and associated support.

OCO: 
FY2019 Overseas Contingency Operations funding to replace 93 GAU-21 machine guns is necessary to reset the force and replace weapons whose service life was expended in direct support of combat operations.

FY2019 Overseas Contingency Operations funding to replace 110 M240 machine guns is necessary to reset the force and replace weapons whose service life was expended in direct support of combat operations.

Name.@footnote: Unit cost projections for MV-22 can fluctuate based on other DoD and FMS customers procurement requirements. The total contracted quantity may result in a slightly lower or higher projected unit cost for MV-22 CDWS hardware.
